About this project


Hi, my name is Jacqueline Unanue, I am a Chilean-Spanish-American visual artist living in Philadelphia PA, USA.

My traveling exhibition will span 3 countries. My Ancient Land series is inspired by the music of Chilean Classical Composers and my multicultural memories.



Perks Summary
More about them below




Exhibition
Main Pieces


The Exhibition is composed of 24 pieces, 7 of them are really big (see below).



Exhibition
The Artwork


Here are all the pieces of it.

See more here.



Inspiration
Chilean Classic Composers


Immersed in this music as I painted, l felt it flow through me physically and found myself expressing both the movement of the music and my own emotions in free and spontaneous brush strokes that are musical as well as gestural.

I’ve been influenced by renowned Chilean classical composers. Among others:

René Amengual

Jorge Urrutia

Eulogio Dávalos

Juan Orrego-Salas

Enrique Soro

Sylvia Soublette



Inspiration
My homeland Chile, Spain, United States


Chile, the country where I was born and where I developed my artistic career, is firmly recorded in my memory. The colors I have used suggest -in an abstract way-, my memories of the geography, the forest, the desert, the ocean, and the Chilean sky.

Those memories are meshed with both the experiences I had in my many travels to Spain to connect with my father’s ancestral roots and also with my experience in the United States where I have lived for almost fifteen years and where I continue to develop an artistic vision formed by my multi-cultural experiences.

About the artist


Jacqueline Unanue was born in Chile, and studied design at the Universidad de Chile de Valparaíso. She traveled extensively through Chile’s Atacama Desert and Altamira caves, Spain, doing on-site research.

In addition to numerous individual and group exhibitions in Chile since 1983, she has also been exhibited in Spain, Finland, Ecuador, Argentina, and the United States—in galleries in Washington D.C., Philadelphia, Chicago, and New York.

Since year 2000, she lives in Philadelphia PA, USA, where she is represented by 3rd Street Gallery.

For more information visit her website
